Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 09:39PM cdean wrote: Hey Ladies, I had a lumpectomy on April 21, later in the afternoon.  Because it was Monday, I had to have the injection for the sentinel node at 8:00 am and surgery was at 1:00 pm.  Apart from some uncomfortableness (?) I faired pretty well.  They took the lump ( approx 2 cm) the sentinel node and 3 auxiliary nodes.  I had a drain for a week.  They took it out yesterday.  I started arm exercises the very next day!  I must say, I don't like them but they've really helped.  Now I wait for lab results.  Sometime next week, they're going to contact me with the results.  Not going to worry about that though (or at least try not to) One day at a time someone told me.  These are words to live by.  So count me in on the tally of April girls.  For those of you recovering from surgery or those of you who haven't had their surgeries yet and for those who have survived this whole ordeal.....God bless!
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 03:56PM cdean wrote: I think waiting is as bad as negative results.  I haven't had my surgery yet.  I've only received results from my biopsy 3 days ago.  My waiting for that was nerve wracking....now I wait to meet with the surgeon.....then I probably wait for surgery.....then wait again for path results from that.   Waiting can make you crazy.  Do as the ladies suggest....be good to yourself, keep busy, try to enjoy your time away from work....you'll be back there soon enough!  Warm regards and here's hoping your wait was for good news. Cathy
